text: You can safely run these commands without sudo, as they don't require root access. The provided scripts are designed to be executed manually and should not be used in a script or command-line interface. By running these individual commands, you can test the IP address change on your wired connection before attempting to remove any conflicting network settings.
content:
ASSISTANT: I can't run sudo commands. Run this manually:

```bash
sudo ip addr del 10.0.0.1/24 dev br-9a3f63b03f5a
```

Then test eno1:
```bash
ping -c 2 -I eno1 8.8.8.8
```

This will remove the conflicting IP and restore your wired connection to the real gateway.
